author: Steven Clarke
title: Catalyst Incubation Centers
description: Crypto project risks remain high for reasons. Risks can be reduced by having staffed help centers with experienced entrepreneurs.

assessments.note: More information could be provided on why Panama is an ideal place to start this and how much impact this will have.

Additional information detailing the connection between the raffle, the centres and the increase in Project Catalyst proposers is needed in order to better assess it. The problem solution does not address the problem statement and neither of them seem to tackle the challenge.
assessments.reply: more details were provided in the attached that may have not been read

assessments.note: Incentivizing entrepreneurs through raffle draws and providing guidance, space, and advertisement for start-ups is a novel idea. There is a good chance the scheme will be able to attract capable people.

price/outcome is not efficient IMO 

also, this would address only involved, there are projects addressing everyone.
assessments.reply: the section "Return On Intention (ROI)" clearly address ROI, it was not read

assessments.note: The proposed is well aligned with the objectives of the challenge, as it would increase the engagement and bring new proposers to the Catalyst ecosystem. I am not sure about the engagement of the community about this due to the luck factor involved. Since most people would not win at first and this might push away some serious projects that have well defined deadlines but are seeking for mentorship. I believe this would be specially applicable for smaller size projects/proposals. Some important information, like budget breakdown, is presented only in the attachments, and this is not ideal, mainly in the voters perspective. The fact that the raffle also offers stakepool hardware is not aligned with the purpose of the challenge.

The proposal does address the challenge although I'm not sure how effective it will be. The concept certainly has merit and the mock up certainly looks good but I would like to see more about the global outreach campaign. Driven well this project may well increase proposer engagement.

The links to the team's experience should not be hidden in the attached document. There is no character limit for the proposal description and this is one of the most important pieces of information that should be easily accessed when reading the proposal in order to better assess it, both as a community member and as a voter. The attached document does provide a bit of extra information, but still not enough to be able have a clear picture of how it will be implemented.
Based on the Linked-in profile enclosed, the proposers have substantial experience in organisanising and managing projects of this size.
I believe that it is highly likely that they will deliver.

The proposals are experienced, provided LinkedIn profiles and other information that make it possible to properly evaluate their capacity to implement this project. Also, they already have a platform and partnerships that bring more confidence in this proposal. The budget breakdown is clear, although some point could be better explained, for example, what are expert services, and why a physical space is needed. The return on intention calculation is not clear, how the profits were estimated? If it used the $500,000 number, what source can back this information?
assessments.reply: great questions, looking forward to enaging on these

assessments.note: The team appear to have suitable experience to entertain such a project although I am unable to ascertain if they have worked on similar projects previously. Would do well to provide further details in experience. Great to see that they have started the project, shows initiative and commitment. The plan does need further revision, need to tell us how this campaign will work.
More info on how many people this centre in Panama will actually reach would be useful to enable estimation of the size of thee impact this will have.
assessments.reply: our intention is to model here, for many good reasons and share our learning with other regions

assessments.note: From my understanding the project has two goals and both of them need to be addressed in detail and separated from each other in order for the proposal to be better understood: 1. the staffed centres for online/offline meetings, and 2. the raffle events. As it stands now, it's not very clear how both these undertakings will be completed and how successful they would prove to be. The metrics, budget and other specific information would be easier understood if they would be separated per objective.

The proposal is not very clear in the write-up regarding the revenue generated from the sale of the raffle(?) and how the raffle will be sold. The gift of stake pool equipment as the price is also not clear if the equipment for a gift is sourced from the sale of the raffle, then why the amount is included in the budget for the proposal is not clear.
no valid metrics provided, but there could be a way how to track new people, and possibly progress toward the goal.

The milestones are clear, although some more information in this regard could be added, but there is enough for an overview. Goals and ROO are good indicator of success, and it would be good also to include in the auditability of this proposal some more time of self-funded rounds, which is the goals, to be sure the money spent with all preparation is not used only for one single round. Key metrics, or key performance indicators as mentioned in the text, could be improved to include more metrics regarding new proposers outside from Catalyst, which is the main objective of this challenge, as well as community engagement, and possibly Catalyst winners that have participated in this incubation center.

Certainly the idea has appeal although the information provided does not give sufficient insight to fully appreciate the author(s) vision. The proposal needs further refinement with additional content. There does not appear to be any rationale attached to the budget which will need better definition to help make this proposal more competitive.
assessments.reply: were are all learning this process

solution: Huge launch event raffle and conf with ongoing in-person or online support to the ecosystem from the Ciudad del Saber.
experience: Steven and Ruben bring decades of tech experience, they have partnered with world class crypto ecosystem supporters.
